intro: Anamirta lactuosa, commonly known as the white soursop or white custard apple, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a flowering plant in the family Annonaceae, characterized by its evergreen leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces a large, fleshy fruit with a yellow or green exterior and a creamy, sweet-tart pulp. The fruit is often used in culinary applications and traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both horticulture and ecological studies.
